text: This should be rolled back <@UB690RZA7> and <@U7AU6414J>
Thanks <@UBFA10FMF>! It be nice to hear about some of these mid-sized updates before they happen, at least so teams can prep for them!

<@U7SL518D6> I always strip those 2 stylesheets out of my main styles. They seem to do more harm then good when coding custom templates, causing a few conflicts that I've had to override. Never noticed any adverse effects.

thanks for that feedback.

I have noticed that the required base is the same as the layout.css that gets forced when using drag n drop templates. kind of a waste of a couple kb of download time

I’ve noticed this with basically every site I’ve been the one to set up AMP support that there appears to be a bug in the amp code, causing the logo to appear next to the blog’s name I think it should appear above it.
If not that, then it atleast shouldn’t be so close to the blog name, maybe left aligned or something.
I realize AMP limits you in what you can do but some of this should be possible.


<https://spin.d.pr/QpqQTI+>
(logo is pixelated for demoing this, it’s not caused by HS)

Hi all, question…
In the HubSpot design manager we had a previous developer create a few landing pages templates that could then be repurposed for other clients. Do you know if deleting that master template file in our agency’s portal will then delete that template on other portals where it’s in use? Or has it essentially just cloned the template into the other portal and removing it will have no effect on the others?
When you clone a template into a different portal, it is its own template and is not a ‘child’ of another template, so deleteing one in a different portal will have no effect
Perfect. I suspected that, but wanted to be sure :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi everyone! Wanted to let all of you know that Marketplace provider portals now have access to HubDB  and can begin including HubDB tables in assets created for the Marketplace. If you're not already a marketplace provider and want to start, you can spin up a provider portal for free here >>> <https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-cms-developer-sandbox>
is the cms for developers certification/lesson up now?
Certification no but a couple lessons are
(atleast when i went through it right after inbound) <@U3PKJ8EQL> might have more now published. I'm excited to see where it goes
